messages.subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] is everyone out there? and SCA
messages.msgSnippet: ... I was worried because I had tried to open the email attachments.  We also just recently reformatted our computer, thanks to a dear friend who is an
messages.messageBody:
>It is too quiet out there. Are any of you virus free?
>Johanna

I was worried because I had tried to open the email
attachments. We also just recently reformatted our
computer, thanks to a dear friend who is an "official"
type computer expert. We had not yet reloaded our
Norton Systemworks on the computer after the reformat.
However, I do not seem to be getting any return
emails from myself, or any more from anyone else
besides the first three. I also have not heard anyone
say that they are getting any from me.

I am not sure if it is my ISP that screens it for me,
or yahoo (my mail server) or something else our friend
might have put on our computer, but I appear to be
virus free.

I also wanted to comment on how interested I was in
following the whole SCA thread. We just recently got
involved with communicating with the SCA folks in the
Seattle/Federal Way area, as we are moving there in a
few months. I am working on the whole business of
trying to create fun personas for hubby and me that
refelct our tastes and interests. We are planning on
doing some events and some camping this summer/fall.

The SCA is also holding their "Arts and Sciences
(Symposium or Conference, can't remember which it is
called) of the Known Worlde" in Seattle this October,
and there will be lots of opportunities to learn and
gain new/old skills from the talented people
presenting. I have already got my hands on the lesson
plan from a lady who will be presenting a class on
historical midwifing practices, since the persona I am
working on is sort of a hedge witch/herbalist/midwife
kind of thing. Like Strega Nona, only not so old!
LOL I also got some book recommendations for her, for
research.

So that is what we are working on right now, besides
packing, selling our house, finding work, etc. %-/
How about you?

Nanci K.
